```{r, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
week_num <- 5  # 1 through 14
#-------------
source(here::here("content", "dates.R"))
library(stringr)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, results = "asis")
letter <- if (week_num <= 7) "A" else "B"
tues_class_num <- paste0(str_pad(week_num * 2 - 2, width = 2, pad = 0), letter)
tues_date <- lec0 + ddays((week_num - 1) * 7)
tues_date_pretty <- paste0(
  month(tues_date, label = TRUE), " ", 
  day(tues_date), ", ", 
  year(tues_date)
)
wed_date <- tues_date + ddays(1)
wed_date_pretty <- paste0(
  month(wed_date, label = TRUE), " ", 
  day(wed_date), ", ", 
  year(wed_date)
)

thurs_class_num <- paste0(str_pad(week_num * 2 - 2 + 1, width = 2, pad = 0), letter)
thurs_date <- tues_date + ddays(2)
thurs_date_pretty <- paste0(
  month(thurs_date, label = TRUE), " ", 
  day(thurs_date), ", ", 
  year(thurs_date)
)
fri_date <- tues_date + ddays(3)
fri_date_pretty <- paste0(
  month(fri_date, label = TRUE), " ", 
  day(fri_date), ", ", 
  year(fri_date)
)

sat_date <- tues_date + ddays(4)
sat_date_pretty <- paste0(
  month(sat_date, label = TRUE), " ", 
  day(sat_date), ", ", 
  year(sat_date)
)
```

<!-- ******TUESDAY'S CLASS****** -->

## Tuesday's Class `r tues_class_num`: Tidy Data

```{r tues-date}
cat(tues_date_pretty)
```

From today's class, students are anticipated to be able to:

- recognize whether a given dataset is 'tidy' or 'untidy'
- convert a dataset between the 'long' and 'wide' format, using `tidyr::pivot_longer()` and `tidyr::pivot_wider()`
- assess which format is best suited for each type of analysis
- deal with missing data in a tibble

#### Prepare for Class

- Watch the [STAT 545 Video Series: Class `r tues_class_num`]()
- Required readings:
  - [Jenny's Intro to Tidy Data](https://github.com/jennybc/lotr-tidy/blob/master/01-intro.md)
    - Note that in `tidyr 1.0.0`, `pivot_longer()` replaced `gather()`, and `pivot_wider()` replaced `spread()`, which are functions you may see in older documentation
  - `tidyr` [vignette](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/tidyr/vignettes/tidy-data.html) on tidy data
  - `pivot` [vignette](https://tidyr.tidyverse.org/articles/pivot.html) with `tidyr`

  
Some useful (but not mandatory) readings are:

- [Hadley's Paper on Tidy Data](https://vita.had.co.nz/papers/tidy-data.pdf) (more thorough)
- Other new [additions](https://www.tidyverse.org/articles/2019/09/tidyr-1-0-0/) in `tidyr

#### During Class

- 9:30 - 9:50: In class demo, covering:
  - `pivot_longer()`
  - `pivot_wider()`
  - univariate pivoting using the `datasets::HairEyeColor` dataset
  - multivariate pivoting using the `iris` dataset
  - `expand()`
  - `complete()`
- 9:50 - 10:00: Quiz
- 10:00 - 10:05: Break
- 10:05 - 10:45: Lecture worksheet

## Thursday's Class `r thurs_class_num`: The Model-Fitting Paradigm in R

```{r thurs-date}
cat(thurs_date_pretty)
```

From today's class, students are anticipated to be able to:

- understand how to fit a linear regression model in R

#### Prepare for Class

- Watch the [STAT 545 Video Series: Class `r thurs_class_num`]()
- Required readings:
  - [`broom`](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/broom/vignettes/broom.html) vignette
  - [Tutorial](https://cfss.uchicago.edu/notes/linear-models/) on model fitting in R (just the linear regression part)

Some useful (but not mandatory) readings are:

- [An Introduction to Statistical Learning](https://www-bcf.usc.edu/~gareth/ISL/)

  - `I()`
  - `augment()`
  - `tidy()`
  - `glance()`
